intro: Psychotria lupulina var. stipulacea, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers and elliptical leaves with prominent veins. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forests. The plant has been studied for its chemical compounds, some of which have potential pharmacological applications.
